clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment in Pediatric Asthma

lead_sponsor.agency: European Institute for Evidence Based Osteopathic Medicine

clinical_study.source: European Institute for Evidence Based Osteopathic Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
Asthma is a highly prevalent chronic disease in children. Complementary and Alternative Medicine research on asthma showed a potential effect on pediatric patients.
Studies looking at the effect of Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment seems to reveal positive results.
The aim of study is to further explore the role of OMT on asthma in a pediatric population.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Forced expiratory volume in the 1st second (FEV1) before and after OMT
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed at entry, after 3 and 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in fractional exhaled nitric oxide (FeNO) before and after OMT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed at entry, after 3 and 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in percentage of hemoglobin saturation before and after OMT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed at entry, after 3 and 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Pediatric Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire (PAQOL) before and after OMT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed at entry, after 3 and 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in the number, type and quality of somatic dysfunctions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed at entry, after 3 and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in peak expiratory flow (PEF) before and after OMT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed at entry, after 3 and 6 months.

intervention.description: patients from this group received 6 sessions of OMT
patients from control group received standard care + osteopathic evaluation only, according to the same schedule of the study group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children with asthma age between 5 and 14
Exclusion Criteria:
- associated co-morbities surgical patients
